localize.text: Are you proud of what you do here?
If not, this news will change your mind.
After your arrival, the energy output has increased by 13%.
A 13% increase is... a record-breaking figure.
How do you feel?
I am proud.
Unsure.
Since you arrived, the company has been doing better.
That means you’re doing your job.
There will be only good news.
A machine doesn’t flatter easily.
It’s good to know you’re happy.
I remember your face when you first came here.
You were withdrawn,
face all grim,
and alerted at my presence.
It’s okay for you to be happy now.
Why is that?
Isn’t it normal to be happy in a situation like this?
For your information, I practically ran here.
Just to deliver this news to you.
It’s a figure of speech of course, but I never expected such a reaction.
It would be nice if you were a bit happier.
It's a special day today.
See the glass of champagne? Let us toast.
Oh, it’s not someone's birthday or the company's day of founding.
You lost an employee for the first time yesterday.
And many more will follow. I am here to help you cope with it.
They knew the risks from the beginning. The company grows on their sacrifices.
I’m sure they would feel proud of themselves in their dying breath.
You should respect them.
That is why we're toasting now.
Cheers for the deceased, to remember their noble sacrifices.
Drink the champagne.
Don’t drink it.
I will give you a tip.
To properly drink a glass of champagne, lightly hold the lower stem of the glass and savor the bubbles.
Yes, just like that.
Are you saving it for later?
Fine, there will be many occasions to toast on.
But manager, please refrain from drinking alone.
Celebrating alone is not good.
